result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Restitution to be paid monthly through his agent.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Continue to work toward obtaining his GED.  Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs, at agent's discretion.  Not to terminate his employment without the agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Not to be present where illegal drugs are used or sold.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant  shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victims, their families or residences.  No contact with any know illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the  agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

records.addlTxt: of 5/31/16 sentencing hearing.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.   Agent H.H. present.  Victim notification complied with.  Attorney Fredrickson made some clarifications regarding the PSI.  No changes noted by the State.  State recommended:  6 year total sentence.  1 year initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with case now serving.  Adopt PSI extended supervision recommendations.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA.  Obtain and maintain employment.  No contact with victims,  any known drug users or dealers.  DNA surcharge.  Defense recommended:  5 years total.   2 year initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  Agrees with the restitution.  Concurrent with current sentencing he is now serving.  Eligible for CIP & SAP.  

Court ordered:  7 years total.  3 years initial confinement,  4 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with sentence now serving.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Continue to obtain GED.  Subject to random alcohol and drug testing by his agent.   AODA and recommended aftercare.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  No contact with victims, their families or residences, or any known drug users or dealers.  DNA surcharge. CC.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.   Restitution:  D.L.  $500.00.  Progressive Insurance. $1,163.96.  Pay monthly through extended supervision.
Sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Probation agent present.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Victim notification discussed.  Probation agent to reach out to victim in the read in case and provide a supplement to the PSI.  Agent to advise the court if she cannot contact the victim by 5/26 at noon.  SEH rescheduled to 5/31 at 10 a.m.
Paper copies to the attorneys.  Sent electronically to Judge Becker.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1, 15CF103, without repeater.  Dismiss, but read in for sentencing purposes remaining count, plus 15CF196.  Victim notification complied with.  Defense waived the filing of an amended information.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of burglary, contrary to 943.10(1m)(a) Wis. Stats.  PSI ordered due 5/13.  SEH set for 5/23 at 1:30 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 03-14-2016 03:00 pm
J. C.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-16-2016 02:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Fredrickson.  Waive reading of information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  Set plea/sentencing.  45 min.  Not on a Monday.

DA Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appears in custody in person from Prairie du Chien Correctional with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Will hear prelim on 15CF103 and an initial appeareance on 15CF196.  Defense waives reading of complaint, waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court reviews right to PH within time limits.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waives time limits in 15CF196 and will track with 15CF103.    State calls witness, A.J., sworn to testify regarding PH.  Found disabled vehicle with steam coming off it; firearm cases in the vehicle which were taken for safe keeping and other items.  Determined some of the property was found to be stolen at a later date.  Multiple people reported a male vehicle driving that vehicle and him going to residents asking for oil.  One person reported that she'd let him inside and he told her things including his name and his family connections.  The vehicle description was the same as the one encountered in the woods.  Talked to T.S. and they saw someone coming out of their house when they came home.  He said the suspect had keys his hand and he made comments of muscle cars which you cannot see unless you go into the shed they were stored in.  They gave him oil and he was on his way.  Deputy Mazur also saw a subject and later he had someone in custody.  Witness ID's defendant - record reflects ID.  Defendant did make a couple statements connecting him to the T.S. property.  Took him back to T.S. residence and the two individuals ID'd him as the one that was there.  Also spoke to Mr. K. - showed where his home was entered.  He said someone was coming in his home and he drew a weapon.  Description matched the subject Mazur had taken into custody.  Mr. K. had something reported as missing at a later time - a cell phone.  He was not charge in the K. case.  SPD Fredrickson cross-examines witness.  No DNA evidence or witness seeing him in or going into shed.  DA Fox continues questioning of witness.  Defendant gave the keys back before T.S. had armed himself.  Interviewed defendant at JASO after waiver or Miranda Rights.  He admitting taking the keys but denied being in the shed or the house.  During interview there were indicators of stimulant use - jumped from idea to idea, excitable, moving, drinking a lot of water, sores on his face.  After giving keys back he ran away to a grouping of pine trees.  Re-cross by SPD Fredrickson.  No DNA or other evidence he was inside the house.  DA calls witness, E.M, sworn and testifies.  ID's defendant - record reflects ID.  Detained him and put in handcuffs.  He asked if this was about the A-frame house which is T.S. residence.  He matched the description given by callers.  Spoke with a woman - he told her he'd been in a traffic crash.  She was trying to help him as he was disshevled and sweating.  SPD Fredrickson cross-examines witness.  No witnesses for defense, moves for dismissal and gives argument.  DA Fox gives argument against dimissal.  Court finds there is probable cause and is bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Prelim to be scheduled on 15CF196 for 45 mintues and have arraignment on both cases at the same time.  Needs to be booked on 15CF196 before being returned to Prairie du Chien.
